poem:
**Standoff at the Threshold**

In Seoul's cold morning light,  
voices entwined in tense air,  
the threshold teeters—  
justice, a hesitant bloom.  
  
Between walls and whispers,  
power stands armored,  
its breath bitter with law,  
desire coiled like wire.  
  
The city holds its breath,  
awaits shift in the ground,  
waiting as witnesses do.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Investigators abandon attempt to arrest South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol South Korea’s political crisis took a dramatic turn on Friday when investigators were forced to abandon an attempt to arrest the impeached president, Yoon Suk Yeol, after a tense standoff with his security forces. Hours after they entered the presidential compound in Seoul, anti-corruption officials said they were halting their attempt to execute a warrant to detain Yoon over allegations that his martial law". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
